Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.wire

Interface SidedWireBlockNode

All Superinterfaces:
BlockNode, SidedBlockNode
public interface SidedWireBlockNode extends SidedBlockNode
A block node wire that occupies the side of a block.

An example of a node like this would be a red-alloy wire from Wired Redstone.

  • Method Details

    • canConnect

      default boolean canConnect(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.server.world.ServerWorld world, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.Direction inDirection, @NotNull @NotNull WireConnectionType connectionType, @NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> other)
      Checks whether this sided block node can connect to the given other block node.
      Parameters:
      self - the block node holder associated with this node.
      world - the block world that both nodes are in.
      inDirection - the direction that the other node is connecting from.
      connectionType - the type of connection that would be formed.
      other - the other block node.
      Returns:
      true if a connection should be allowed to form, false otherwise.
